findings.title: removeLiquidity ETHSupportingFeeOnTransferTokens
findings.description: External call to remove liquidity with ETH supporting fee on transfer tokens

findings.title: removeLiquidity ETHWithPermit SupportingFeeOnTransferTokens
findings.description: External function 'removeLiquidity ETHWithPermit' supporting fee-on-transfer tokens is marked as critical.

findings.title: swapExactTokensForTokensSupportingFeeOnTransferTokens
findings.description: The function does not properly handle tokens with fees on transfer.

findings.title: swapExactETHForTokensSupportingFeeOnTransferTokens
findings.description: The function swapExactETHForTokensSupportingFeeOnTransferTokens is marked as external and has a warning symbol, indicating potential security risks.

findings.title: swapExactTokensForETHSupportingFeeOnTransferTokens
findings.description: The function allows swapping exact tokens for ETH while supporting fee-on-transfer tokens.

findings.title: distributeDividends
findings.description: The distributeDividends function has a vulnerability.

findings.title: withdrawDividend
findings.description: Potential vulnerability in withdrawDividend function

findings.title: _withdrawDividendOfUser
findings.description: No description provided in the audit report.

findings.title: Unprotected Function 'dividendOf'
findings.description: The 'dividendOf' function is declared as external and does not have any access modifiers, making it vulnerable to unauthorized access.

findings.title: withdrawableDividendOf
findings.description: N/A

findings.title: Unprotected Access to withdrawnDividendOf
findings.description: The withdrawnDividendOf function allows public access without any restrictions, potentially leading to unauthorized manipulation of user dividends.

findings.title: accumulativeDividendOf
findings.description: Potential vulnerability in the accumulativeDividendOf function.

findings.title: _transferfrom() Method Overrides Current Allowance
findings.description: The _transferfrom() method overrides current allowance regardless of whether the spender already used it or not, so there is no way to increase or decrease allowance by a certain value atomically unless the token owner is a smart contract, not an account.

findings.title: _mint
findings.description: Hidden mint functions may increase the amount of tokens in circulation and affect the price of the token. Owner can mint new tokens and sell.

findings.title: _burn
findings.description: Potential reentrancy vulnerability in _burn function.

findings.title: _setBalance
findings.description: External function _setBalance can be modified by onlyOwner.

findings.title: updateStakingAmounts
findings.description: N/A

findings.title: enableTrading
findings.description: If there is a function for this Developer can set zero fee or no max wallet size for addresses (for example team wallets can trade without fee. Can cause farming)

findings.title: setPresaleWallet
findings.description: Function can set zero fee or no max wallet size for addresses, allowing team wallets to trade without fee and potentially causing farming.

findings.title: setExcludeFees
findings.description: The setExcludeFees function has a vulnerability related to onlyOwner access control.

findings.title: setExcludeDividends
findings.description: The setExcludeDividends function has a vulnerability.

findings.title: setReinvest
findings.description: External function setReinvest has restricted access and can only be called by the owner.

findings.title: setDividendsPaused
findings.description: The setDividendsPaused function has been identified as a potential security risk.

findings.title: isExcludedFromAutoClaim
findings.description: Potential vulnerability in the isExcludedFromAutoClaim function.

findings.title: isReinvest
findings.description: N/A

findings.title: _transferfrom() Method Override
findings.description: The _transferfrom() method overrides current allowance regardless of whether the spender already used it or not, allowing a token receiver to withdraw certain tokens from the sender's account, enabling a front-running attack affecting the ERC20 Approve function.

findings.title: getStakingBalance
findings.description: N/A

findings.title: swapAndLiquify
findings.description: Potential vulnerability in swapAndLiquify function

findings.title: swapTokensForEth
findings.description: Private function swapTokensForEth has a potential vulnerability.

findings.title: updatePayoutToken
findings.description: N/A

findings.title: getPayoutToken
findings.description: Publicly accessible function without access control

findings.title: setMinimumTokenBalanceForAutoDividends
findings.description: Potential vulnerability in setting minimum token balance for auto dividends

findings.title: setMinimumTokenBalanceForDividends
findings.description: The setMinimumTokenBalanceForDividends function has a vulnerability.

findings.title: addLiquidity
findings.description: External function call without access control or validation.

findings.title: forceSwapAndSendDividends
findings.description: This function allows an attacker to drain the contract by repeatedly calling it and swapping the tokens, causing a loss of funds.

findings.title: Unprotected Function Call
findings.description: The 'swapAndSendDividends' function has unrestricted access and can be called by anyone, potentially leading to unauthorized dividend distribution.

findings.title: excludeFromDividends
findings.description: The excludeFromDividends function allows owners to exclude certain addresses from receiving dividends, which can lead to unfair distribution of funds.
